title: Payments Operation Analyst Job at Citibank Nigeria Limited
content:
Citibank Nigeria Limited (CNL) was incorporated in Nigeria on May 2, 1984 and the oldest international bank in the country. It provides a wide range of financial products and services to corporate and commercial customers, financial institutions and public sector organizations. It offers deposit and loan products, global transaction services, cash management, sales and trading, corporate finance and investment banking products.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Payments Operation Analyst

Job Req ID: 25871794
Job Location: Kano, Nigeria
Job type: Full-time
Work mode: On-Site/Resident
Job Category Transaction Services

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Payments Operation Analyst is an intermediate level role responsible for executing complex transactions and participating in complex processes in coordination with the Branch Services team.
	The overall objective is to act as a subject matter expert while processing all regular payments.


Responsibilities


	Performing processing activities (processing local, cross border payments, other transactions e.g. expense tickets, Tax collections, counter cheques, check deposits, Vault Operations and Cash - In - Transit management) and managing supporting documentation related to payments
	Proper handling of customers instruction brought to the branch and ensure correctness as well as managing various customer requests (in person and on phone) on daily basis
	Conducting communication with all stakeholders including clients, internal partners, regulators particularly Central Bank of Nigeria, Nigeria Customs Service and Scanning & Risk Service Providers
	Solving current processing issues and taking action in order to optimize the process
	Compliance with applicable regulatory guidelines, laws of Nigeria and Citigroup corporate policy, local procedures, product programs and international conventions
	Preparation and sending of regulatory reports to the relevant regulatory Bodies


Qualifications


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor’s / University Degree with a minimum of 6 years of post qualification experience
	Fundamental comprehension of financial industry regulations
	Effective communication in both written and spoken English
	Well-developed analytical skills including investigative mindset, independence in problem solving and a keen eye to detail
	Risk awareness
	Good knowledge of Microsoft Office preferred


What We Can Offer You


	This is a role that'll offer you the opportunity to build an in-depth knowledge of financial services operations. Every day there will be new business challenges that will help you develop new skills that can drive your career
	By joining Citi Nigeria, you will not only be part of a business casual workplace, but also receive a competitive base salary (which is annually reviewed) and enjoy a whole host of additional benefits that support you (and your family) to be well, live well and save well.
	Alongside these benefits Citi is committed to ensuring our workplace is where everyone feels comfortable coming to work as their whole self every day.  We want the best talent around the world to be energized to join us, motivated to stay, and empowered to thrive.

title: Risk & Compliance (H&S) Manager Job at Atlas
content:
Atlas - We believe in a world where growth thrives across borders and cultures. Our mission is to guide companies on their journey by providing services and technology that enables global talent management and delivers a human experience. As an Employer-of-Record (EOR) provider, we offer the HR and compliance infrastructure essential for companies to expand internationally. We take care of the complex, behind-the-scenes work, allowing companies to focus on the strategies that drive their success. We are For People, By People. The future of work is borderless, and so are we.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Our people are located around the globe — in the U.S., the UK, India, Colombia, China, and beyond. Diversity and belonging are not just values, they are who we are. We are also committed to making a positive impact. Through our Environment, Social, and Governance (ESG) impact initiative, we are addressing our environmental footprint and promoting social responsibility. Our impact program is central to our vision and culture, focusing on employee wellness, diversity, charitable work, and ethical corporate governance.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Risk & Compliance (H&S) Manager

Job Location: Nigeria
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	As the Risk & Compliance Manager, you will play a pivotal role in advancing Atlas’ Health & Safety (H&S) program in 160+ Atlas countries.
	You will work closely with the Risk & Compliance Senior Manager to help design and implement a global safety program from the ground up.
	As a key member of the Risk & Compliance team, you will also be managing specific enterprise-wide risk mitigation projects and leading the development of H&S corporate policy and localizing them where required. 


Key Responsibilities


	Ensure Compliance & Risk Management – Monitor, interpret, and implement H&S policies to meet or exceed regulatory requirements worldwide.
	Informing and educating different departments on the requirements and building cross-functional relationships to ensure compliance with regulations 
	Research - Lead the research component of the H&S program by developing a database of H&S rules and regulations for different countries. 
	Collaborate Across Functions – Work with internal HR/HRSD, Operations, Legal & Compliance, Data Privacy and other business areas globally and ensure they are aware of the H&S requirements to implement the program. 
	Incident Management – Assist in the rollout of H&S incident management module in Atlas’ Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) tool. Train Operations team on how to utilize the module, and record incidents.  
	Risk Management - Assess potential H&S risks of existing entity/country operations and new business opportunities and coordinate mitigation efforts with the relevant departments. 
	Anti-Harassment – Ensure H&S research includes local country’s anti-harassment requirements and help develop localized policies as required. 
	Policies and SOPs - Assist in updating policies, procedures and frameworks that align with industry standards and best practices. 
	Enterprise Risk Projects - Manage enterprise-wide risk mitigation projects as assigned.  


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in environmental health & safety, occupational safety, human resources, employment law or a related field. 
	5+ years of progressive experience in OHS, employment law or HR within a complex, fast-paced corporate environment. 
	Excellent project management and organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment 
	Strong attention to detail in maintaining thorough policies, plans, and procedures. 
	Leadership presence and capability to direct teams under pressure during an H&S incident. 


What We Offer 


	The opportunity to work with a purpose — simplifying global expansion across borders and cultures
	A diverse and inclusive environment
	Country-specific benefits
	Flexible PTO
	Your birthday off and a day for you to volunteer and give back to the organization of your choice
	Generous Parental Leave Program
	Growth and development opportunities with access to a top learning content provider
	The opportunity to challenge yourself in a high-performing organization and leave each day knowing you have made an impact.


Note


	This position description may not describe all duties, responsibilities, and skills associated with this position.
	It is intended to portray the major aspects of the job. Other duties or skills may be required.
	Atlas Technology Solutions, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind

title: IT Support Technician Job at Cavista
content:
Cavista is a global technology company creating cloud-based software solutions for clients. With operations around the world, we globalize, standardize and localize our processes, while at the same time remaining sensitive to specific needs in different regions. Our mission is to empower organizations with the world’s best technology solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Support Technician

Job Location: Ilupeju, Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a highly skilled Female IT Support Technician to provide technical assistance and support for hardware, software, and network related issues across the organization.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for troubleshooting IT problems, maintaining systems, and ensuring smooth day to day operations for end users.
	This role requires expertise in Microsoft Azure, cloud infrastructure, and IT security best practices.


Responsibilities
What you will do:


	Provide first-line technical support to employees by diagnosing and resolving hardware, software, and network-related issues.
	Install, configure, and maintain computers, printers, mobile devices, and other IT equipment to ensure optimal performance.
	Respond to IT service requests and incidents in a timely manner, ensuring minimal disruption to operations.
	Perform system updates, patches, and software installations to maintain security and efficiency.
	Assist in IT asset inventory management, tracking and documenting IT equipment and licenses.
	Monitor and maintain IT infrastructure, including servers, networks, and security systems, with a focus on Microsoft Azure cloud services.
	Manage Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) for user account provisioning, access controls, and security policies.
	Assist with user account management, including password resets, access requests, and system configurations.
	Support remote employees by troubleshooting VPN, cloud-based systems, and remote desktop environments.
	Collaborate with the IT team on projects, upgrades, and implementation of new technologies, particularly Azure-based solutions.
	Implement Azure security best practices, including role-based access control (RBAC), identity protection, and endpoint security.
	Provide user training and guidance on IT best practices, cloud-based collaboration tools, and security protocols.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
	1-3 years of experience in IT support, helpdesk, or technical support roles.
	Proficiency in troubleshooting Windows, macOS, and Linux operating systems.
	Hands-on experience with Microsoft Azure administration, including Azure AD, virtual machines, and cloud security.
	Strong knowledge of Active Directory, Office 365, networking protocols, and cloud-based services.
	Familiarity with ticketing systems and IT service management frameworks (e.g., ITIL).
	Knowledge of cybersecurity best practices, firewalls, and endpoint security.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
	Strong problem-solving skills, customer service orientation, and excellent communication abilities.


Benefits


	Competitive Compensation 
	5 - day workweek
	Flextime
	Competitive Health Insurance (Employee + Spouse + 4 children)
	Wellness Programs
	Employee Training Programs
	Growth and Development
